0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Allergy to penicillin; Diagnosis: puncture test, apply small drop to skin surface using a 22 to 28 gauge needle and puncture epidermis through the drop of solution; observe test site for 15 min
  • Allergy to penicillin; Diagnosis: intradermal test, inject amount sufficient to raise 2 INTRADERMAL blebs of 3 mm in diameter at least 2 cm apart; inject like amount of saline as control at least 5 cm removed from test site; read skin test at 20 min

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• Allergy to penicillin; Diagnosis: puncture test, apply small drop to skin surface using a 22 to 28 gauge needle and puncture epidermis through the drop of solution; observe test site for 15 min
  • Allergy to penicillin; Diagnosis: intradermal test, inject amount sufficient to raise 2 INTRADERMAL blebs of 3 mm in diameter at least 2 cm apart; inject like amount of saline as control at least 5 cm removed from test site; read skin test at 20 min

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• extreme hypersensitivity to penicillin
  • hypersensitivity to benzylpenicilloyl polylysine

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• adult patients with no history of clinical penicillin hypersensitivity; skin test alone may not be adequate in predicting risk of therapeutic penicillin administration
  • assessing risk of administering semisynthetic penicillins (phenoxymethyl penicillin, ampicillin, carbenicillin, dicloxacillin, methicillin, nafcillin, oxacillin, amoxicillin), cephalosporin-derived antibiotics, and penem antibiotics; skin test alone may not be adequate
  • pediatric patients; skin test alone may not be adequate in predicting risk of therapeutic penicillin administration

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Benzylpenicilloyl polylysine specifically reacts with benzylpenicilloyl IgE antibodies to produce an immediate wheal and flare reaction at a skin test site due to release of chemical mediators. The skin test identifies the presence of penicilloyl IgE antibodies, which are required, but not sufficient for acute allergic reactions due to the penicilloyl determinant. This skin test antigen is used to assess penicillin allergy status.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• Intradermal
    perform intradermal skin test only if puncture test is entirely negative or questionable (less than 5 mm wheal with little or no erythema and no itching)
  • Intraepidermal route
    perform puncture skin testing first to decrease risk of systemic allergic reaction; perform puncture skin testing in the inner volar aspect of the forearm

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• puncture test: interpret after 15 minutes; pale wheal with or without pseudopods of 5 to 15 mm or greater in diameter developing within 10 minutes indicates a positive response
  • intradermal test: interpret after 20 minutes; itching and increase in bleb to at least 5 mm and possible wheal greater than 20 mm with pseudopods indicates a positive response

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono: This drug may cause local inflammation or systemic allergic reaction.
